Are you kidding? It's different suchi. 
Dude, suchitra karthik kumar is RJ turned singer. She's not a trained classical singer and she never sang for rahman. Just look at the sargam. I think she's bengali and her voice is beautiful...
snippet.textOriginal:
Are you kidding? It's different suchi. 
Dude, suchitra karthik kumar is RJ turned singer. She's not a trained classical singer and she never sang for rahman. Just look at the sargam. I think she's bengali and her voice is beautiful...

snippet.textDisplay: Where the mind is without fear and the head is held high;Where knowledge is free;Where the world has not been broken up into fragments by narrow domestic walls;Where words come out from the depth of truth;Where tireless striving stretches its arms towards perfection;Where the clear stream of reason has not lost its way into the dreary desert sand of dead habit;Where the mind is led forward by thee into ever-widening thought and action;Into that heaven of freedom, my Father, let my country awake.

snippet.textDisplay: Why to sing Tagore's magnificient lines with distorted pronunciation in the beginning, surprised to see some of the bengalis grateful and appreciative too that the song uses those verses. As such without this part the song has Rahman's famous touch and is nice, the classical parts  miss notes by narrow margins at places though and the rapping is absolutely unnecessary, doesnt evoke any patriotic sentiments. Nice song, but could be better without not required frills and fancy  extravaganza
snippet.textOriginal: Why to sing Tagore's magnificient lines with distorted pronunciation in the beginning, surprised to see some of the bengalis grateful and appreciative too that the song uses those verses. As such without this part the song has Rahman's famous touch and is nice, the classical parts  miss notes by narrow margins at places though and the rapping is absolutely unnecessary, doesnt evoke any patriotic sentiments. Nice song, but could be better without not required frills and fancy  extravaganza

Into the dreary desert sand of dead habit

Into ever-widening thought and action
Into that heaven of

snippet.textDisplay: ^^^ (Tui bangla janis na re) you dont know bengali yaar.. Or you may be too possessive about Tagore ( Tagore tor baper naa re tagore sara bharoter).. snippet.textDisplay:
Where the mind is without fear and the head is held high
Where knowledge is free
Where the world has not been broken up into fragments by narrow domestic walls
Where words come out from the depth of truth;
Where tireless striving stretches its arms towards perfection
Where the clear stream of reason has not lost its way into the dreary desert sand of dead habit
Where the mind is led forward by thee into ever-widening thought and action
Into that heaven of freedom, my Father, let my country awake
snippet.textOriginal:

Where knowledge is free
Where the world has not been broken up into fragments by narrow domestic walls
Where words come out from the depth of truth;
Where tireless striving stretches its arms towards perfection
Where the clear stream of reason has not lost its way into the dreary desert sand of dead habit
Where the mind is led forward by thee into ever-widening thought and action
Into that heaven of freedom, my Father, let my country awake

snippet.textDisplay:
চিত্ত যেথা ভয়শূন্য, উচ্চ যেথা শির,
জ্ঞান যেথা মুক্ত, যেথা গৃহের প্রাচীর
আপন প্রাঙ্গণতলে দিবসশর্বরী
বসুধারে রাখে নাই খণ্ড ক্ষুদ্র করি,
যেথা বাক্য হৃদয়ের উত্‍‌সমুখ হতে
উচ্ছ্বসিয়া উঠে, যেথা নির্বারিত স্রোতে
দেশে দেশে দিশে দিশে কর্মধারা ধায়
অজস্র সহস্রবিধ চরিতার্থতায়,
যেথা তুচ্ছ আচারের মরুবালুরাশি
বিচারের স্রোতঃপথ ফেলে নাই গ্রাসি---
পৌরুষেরে করে নি শতধা, নিত্য যেথা
তুমি সর্ব কর্ম চিন্তা আনন্দের নেতা,
নিজ হস্তে নির্দয় আঘাত করি, পিতঃ,
ভারতেরে সেই স্বর্গে করো জাগরিত॥
snippet.textOriginal:
চিত্ত যেথা ভয়শূন্য, উচ্চ যেথা শির,
জ্ঞান যেথা মুক্ত, যেথা গৃহের প্রাচীর
আপন প্রাঙ্গণতলে দিবসশর্বরী
বসুধারে রাখে নাই খণ্ড ক্ষুদ্র করি,
যেথা বাক্য হৃদয়ের উত্‍‌সমুখ হতে
উচ্ছ্বসিয়া উঠে, যেথা নির্বারিত স্রোতে
দেশে দেশে দিশে দিশে কর্মধারা ধায়
অজস্র সহস্রবিধ চরিতার্থতায়,
যেথা তুচ্ছ আচারের মরুবালুরাশি
বিচারের স্রোতঃপথ ফেলে নাই গ্রাসি---
পৌরুষেরে করে নি শতধা, নিত্য যেথা
তুমি সর্ব কর্ম চিন্তা আনন্দের নেতা,
নিজ হস্তে নির্দয় আঘাত করি, পিতঃ,
ভারতেরে সেই স্বর্গে করো জাগরিত॥

snippet.textDisplay: Rabindranath was very progressive even at his time. So I feel he would have appreciated and liked the effort by Rahman. I don't see why ppl think that rabindranath won't like it. And if you talk about pronunciation?  As a bengali I think he has fone a superb job! Cheers
snippet.textOriginal: Rabindranath was very progressive even at his time. So I feel he would have appreciated and liked the effort by Rahman. I don't see why ppl think that rabindranath won't like it. And if you talk about pronunciation?  As a bengali I think he has fone a superb job! Cheers

snippet.textDisplay:
ARR, now you touched hearts of Bengal!!  He has been mesmerizing tamil music for 2 decades. still remember when sang the hindu wedding sloga ''Mangalyam tantunanena mama jeevana hetuna: kanthe badhnami subhage twam jeeva sarada satam''
to this...
watch?v=zclgPe8g8uA

still this version is played in most weddings!
